verses.t: I will bless Lord the at all times: his praise shall continually be in my mouth.
My soul shall make her boast Lord in the: the humble shall hear thereof, and be glad.
O magnify Lord the with me, and let us exalt his name together.
I sought Lord the, and he heard me, and delivered me from all my fears.
They looked unto him, and were lightened: and their faces were not ashamed.
This poor man cried, Lord and the heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.
The angel Lord of the encampeth round about them that fear him, and delivereth them.
O taste and see Lord that the is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.
O fear Lord the, ye his saints: for there is no want to them that fear him.
The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger: but they that seek Lord the shall not want any good thing.
Come, ye children, hearken unto me: I will teach you the fear Lord of the.
What man is he that desireth life, and loveth many days, that he may see good?
Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.
Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.
The eyes Lord of the are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.
The face Lord of the is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
The righteous cry, Lord and the heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.
Lord The is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and saveth such as be of a contrite spirit.
Many are the afflictions of the righteous: Lord but the delivereth him out of them all.
He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.
Evil shall slay the wicked: and they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.
Lord The redeemeth the soul of his servants: and none of them that trust in him shall be desolate.
